summary: App experiencing startup blank-screen issues due to bootstrap error screens; user requests removal of StartupBootstrapError.tsx and ProfileBootstrapError.tsx. Additional functional bugs reported around vehicle reporting (lost/stolen/pawned) UI crash, and vehicle registration/listing/release inconsistencies between user and admin views. User requests fixes without impacting currently working features.
architectural_notes: When applying fixes, avoid regressions: do not change features already working normally (limit scope to requested fixes).
known_issues: Startup blocked/blank screen due to bootstrap error screen components (StartupBootstrapError/ProfileBootstrapError) and retry delay behavior.
React DOM error on vehicle report (lost/stolen/pawned): "Failed to execute 'removeChild' on 'Node'".
Vehicle appears in admin and status-check but not in user's vehicle list; releasing/detaching vehicle shows generic error.

existing_features.title: Fix the user vehicle listing inconsistency so that a vehicle that exists in the system (visible in admin totals and via Vehicle Check) reliably appears in the owning user’s “My Vehicles” list when the backend record owner matches the currently signed-in principal.

Add safe, minimal frontend error handling for “My Vehicles” and “Revoke Ownership” flows so that backend/query errors are displayed clearly (in English) instead of silently showing empty lists or a generic “something went wrong”, without changing unrelated features or routes.

new_feature_requests.summary: Remove/disable bootstrap error screens by deleting StartupBootstrapError.tsx and ProfileBootstrapError.tsx to prevent app startup being blocked/blank screen.
Fix React UI crash on 'Lapor kendaraan hilang/dicuri/digadai' flow (removeChild DOM error) so reporting works without errors.
Fix vehicle registration/listing inconsistency: vehicle shows in admin and status-check but not in user's 'Kendaraan saya' list; also fix errors when releasing/detaching vehicle ('lepas' action).

Fix the backend revoke/detach ownership flow so that when a user revokes ownership ("lepas" / "hapus" vehicle), the vehicle is consistently removed or detached in a way that allows the same engine+chassis to be registered again, and the operation no longer returns a generic error.
